data.title: InventHelp client creates Hoverboard Assist Chair (SGM-609) in Iowa to improve balance while learning to use a hoverboard.
data.description: In Pittsburgh on February 26, 2026, an inventor from Lohrville, Iowa, shared his innovative product - the HOVERBOARD ASSIST CHAIR. The inventor aimed to provide support and enhance balance for individuals learning to use a hoverboard. This invention is designed to potentially minimize falls during the learning process.

data.title: Global pharmaceutical manufacturing equipment market to reach $30.39 billion by 2032, with a CAGR of 6.2%.
data.description: In Delray Beach, Florida, on February 26, 2026, it was reported that the global pharmaceutical manufacturing equipment market is anticipated to hit USD 21.24 billion by 2026 and is expected to rise to USD 30.39 billion by 2032. The market is forecasted to grow at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 6.2% over the said period. For more information, interested parties can explore 165...

data.title: NBDF's "Educate to Elevate" campaign with celebrity advocates aims to raise awareness for bleeding disorders.
data.description: A group of well-known figures has united with NBDF to raise awareness about misdiagnosis and enhance treatment for the numerous individuals managing bleeding disorders. As of February 26, 2026, the National Bleeding Disorders Foundation (NBDF) has introduced Educate to Elevate, a long-term program aimed at addressing this issue. The initiative includes participation from multiple celebrities and is a concerted effort to improve care for the millions affected by bleeding disorders.

data.title: Teamsters at Metal Container Corporation, a subsidiary of Anheuser-Busch InBev, ratified a new agreement securing significant wage improvements; more than 245 members of Local 6 involved.
data.description: Over 245 Teamsters belonging to Local 6 at Metal Container Corporation, a subsidiary of Anheuser-Busch InBev, have approved a substantial wage enhancement in the latest agreement. The members, involved in can manufacturing for diverse purposes, have secured significant improvements in their pay.

data.title: Synopsys stock fell after Q1 results, cut fiscal 2026 EPS, issued Q2 sales guidance below estimates. Quarterly revenue: $2.41B.
data.description: Synopsys, Inc. (SNPS) stock declined after reporting Q1 results where they posted an adjusted EPS of $3.77 (beat estimate of $3.56) and revenue of $2.41 billion (surpassed estimate of $2.39 billion). The company reduced its fiscal 2026 GAAP EPS guidance below expectations and issued Q2 sales guidance lower than estimates. Synopsys' CEO mentioned the company's growth in AI capabilities driving system-level and semiconductor R&D. The board also approved a $2.0 billion stock repurchase program. The company revised its fiscal 2026 adjusted EPS guidance to $14.38-$14.46. More details are available on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Global Environmental Solutions acquires Environmental Controls Company, expanding water infrastructure platform. Acquisition completed January 25, 2026.
data.description: On February 26, 2026, in Manchester, New Hampshire, Global Environmental Solutions, LLC (GES), a prominent company in environmental control technologies, disclosed the finalization of an asset acquisition deal with Environmental Controls Company, LLC (ECC) on January 25, 2026. The acquisition marks a significant move in the industry.

data.title: Probiotic supplements market to reach USD 37.5 billion by 2036, with digestive health as anchor segment and Lactobacillus leading.
data.description: The main segment in the market continues to be digestive health, with Lactobacillus being the most sought-after strain. The demand for probiotic supplements is rising, particularly in capsules, powders, and liquids. Future Market Insights (FMI) forecasts that the global probiotic supplements market is expected to witness significant growth. The adoption of probiotics in everyday products is driven by varying colony-forming unit (CFU) ranges.

data.title: Yerucham Zvi Winer, aka Mr. Black, running for Florida Governor on platform of faith, family, and freedom.
data.description: A prominent figure in the business and bitcoin sectors, Yerucham Zvi Winer, or Mr. Black, is shifting his focus to Florida politics by entering the gubernatorial race. With an established presence in the industry, Winer aims to emphasize strong leadership and family values in his campaign. This move comes as a new direction for Winer who has previously been recognized for his achievements in both business and bitcoin spheres. The announcement of his bid for governor signals a significant shift in his career trajectory towards public service.

data.title: YachtWorld and Sunshine Cruising Yachts partner to empower boutique firms with data and tech for enterprise scale.
data.description: Announced on February 26, 2026, in Miami, the partnership between YachtWorld, a division of Boats Group, and Sunshine Cruising has been strengthened, highlighting the capability of Boats Group's data, technology, and worldwide influence in enabling boutique firms to function at a large enterprise level. This enhanced partnership underscores how smaller firms can benefit from the resources provided by Boats Group, showcasing the potential for growth and development.

data.title: Carter's to report a $1.70 EPS on 2026-02-27; surpassed by $0.01 led to -4.43% stock drop last quarter. Stock at $41.92.
data.description: Carter's (NYSE: CRI) is set to announce its quarterly earnings on February 27, 2026, with analysts anticipating an EPS of $1.70. The market is eager for a potential beat on estimates and positive guidance for the next quarter. In the last quarter, Carter's missed EPS by $0.01, resulting in a 4.43% share price drop the following day. Historical performance shows mixed results, with price changes following earnings announcements in the last four quarters ranging from -19.69% to +2.39%. As of February 25, Carter's shares were trading at $41.92, with a 1.82% increase over the past 52 weeks. Positive returns suggest long-term shareholders are optimistic heading into the earnings release. Investors are advised to watch for guidance as a key driver of stock prices.

data.title: Thrust Flight wins 5-year pilot training contract from City of Phoenix, 2 students/certificate per year.
data.description: In Phoenix, a prominent U.S. aviation training provider, Thrust Flight, has secured the Fixed Wing Pilot Training RFP (PP24-284) for the City of Phoenix. The contract spans five years starting around March 1 and will involve training about two students per certificate yearly across five certificate categories: Private Pilot (PPL), Commercial Pilot (CPL), Instrument Rating (IR), Certified Flight Instructor (CFI), and Certified Flight...
